page.title: 09The Tamar Protection Society
page.content: This voluntary{club}is concerned with the conservation and{ecology}of the Tamar Valley, mainly along the tidal reaches below Gunnislake. This proposed area of outstanding natural beauty has great scenic value and important wildlife habitats. The TPS was founded in 1967 to fight off a coal-fired power station at Insworke Point. Since this successful opposition the main{social concern}of the TPS is preventing undesirable and sporadic development and exploitation of this beautiful area. It makes representation to planning authorities and has been involved in public enquiries. It also seeks to educate public{attitude}to the environment's contribution to the quality of life. Recent concerns include mining proposals, listed buildings,footpaths, tree-felling licences, and marinas.
